Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2009 04:43AM tania_s wrote: Hope Femara works.  It only helped me for 6 months and then stopped working and the tumours grew in other places of the bone. Good luck, i hope it works for you.  I also experienced Rheumatoid Arthritis but took Glucosamine with condroiton.
Posts.Title: Starting femera tomorrow lovinmomma pookie61

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2008 08:12PM tania_s wrote: surprised you have dry face. Try bio oil! very hydrating for skin. For feet and hands, I've used 'everything' but best is bio oil and bepanthem together.  I also try moisturising every few hours.
Posts.Title: Xeloda Question greta tania_s

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2009 03:19AM tania_s wrote: I was on Xeloda for 1 year and 4 months.  It worked really well for the first 8 months and I deteriorated rapidly in my health and the tumours grew. Xeloda gave me a lot of side effects but the worst were my hands and feet. My feet were red raw and sometimes I could not even walk.  Use a heap of moisturiser constantly throughout the day - even that my not help but its something at least. Good luck for your mum
Posts.Title: Xeloda Hopeful101 LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2010 12:14AM tania_s wrote: Hormonals worked for the first 5 years and have done nothing since. My oncologist says that receptors can change,  I will ask him if he can do a test to find out what receptors they are now.  Look, at least the lesions are no where else in my body, my bones are controlled and well, I hope the liver can be too. Thanks for caring.
Posts.Title: Liver scan results tania_s chainsawz

Posts.Content: tania_s wrote: I just heard from my gp as my oncologist is away today.  She just got results from my ct scan.  The original liver tumour was 4 cm, which is now 3 cm and 2 more lesions have been found, one is 3 cm and the other is 1 cm.  So I wonder what on earth the Taxol/Gemzar - 8 rounds did!!!!  My gp reckons I need a break from chemo, but I am out of sorts, why on earth did 2 new lesions come out during chemo or were they there already and not picked up by the ultrasound 5 months ago.  On a positive note, my lungs are clear and so is the rest of my abdomen and pelvis.  I am exhausted. Dx 12/8/1999, LCIS, 6cm+, Stage IV, 12/12 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: tania_s wrote: Ever since I have been on Chemotherapy I find that unless I am in the sunshine reading, I cannot read without a magnify glass.  I wear glasses and my optomotrist told me that the chemotherapy affects the muscles behind the eye and once chemo is over, the eyesight improves.  Has anybody else experienced this? Posts.Title: Pain during Gemzar Infusion tania_s Bonnielv

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2010 07:42PM tania_s wrote: I am in exactly your boat!!! I have had mets to bones for 3 years and in September 09 found out mets to liver - I did not function for 4 weeks - I was in shock and probably still am.  I am on Taxol/Gemzar which is wiping me out - but I too have kids - 3 and I pick up the pieces every day, put a smile on my face and keep on going for their sake.  Thankfully we have kids that will keep us going - all the milestones that we will not miss....we need to be optomistic.  Let me tell you what a friend told me last week. " you had bc 10 years ago and it came back 7 years later at Stage 4, you were treated then, and 7 years later new treatments were available...and if you keep on going for another 7 years...more new treatments will be available and you will live this way.." you know what, I tend to agree with her, hang in there...we are all in this together...

Posts.Content: tania_s wrote: I had my 5th Taxol/Gemzar treatment yesterday.  The 4th was awful, with terrible joint and bone pain for 4 days and very very weak.  I woke up today feeling very week and in pain.  My doctor has given me panadeine forte (I am Australian - I think you call it Coedine forte) and even with this strong stuff, I feel lousy.  Any ideas??? Just to get rid of the weakness at least. Dx 12/8/1999, LCIS, 6cm+, Stage IV, 12/12 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Bone Pain during Taxol/Gemzar treatment tania_s konakat

Posts.Content: tania_s wrote: Well I have tried so many for my bone and liver disease. I had a ct scan yesterday on the liver before I continued with Caelyx chemo, and the liver has gone from bad to worse.  3 1/2 years of treatment and nothing has been able to control my disease or at least give me a break from treatment. Where is this all leading to.  I am due to see a Professor here in Melbourne who has a clinical trial on Selective Internal Radiation Therapy.  I just hope that I am a candidate for this type of treatment.  It sends radiation into the liver via the groin. If this fails, what next??????  If 4 chemos have failed, whats to say the others will help? Dx 12/8/1999, LCIS, 6cm+, Stage IV, 12/12 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Femara,Xeloda,Taxotere,Taxol, Caelyx, what next??? tania_s ChocolateLover

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2010 07:52PM tania_s wrote: Hi, I posted on this site on the 28th July, Femara, Xeloda,Taxotere, Taxol, Gemzar, Caelyx. Take a look.  I have been on all of these and nothing has controlled my liver mets, in fact, on Taxol and Caelyx, they progressed. I was diagnosed with BC in 1999 and due to A C and Tamoxifan I had 7 years clear.  The next chemo by doctor will try is A C as he says I had 6 then and can have another 4 now (as long as my heart can tolerate it).  It is a bugger of a chemo, but 10 years later, I am sure that they have many more tablets to control all the side effects.  Today I am seeing a Professor here in Melbourne to see if I am a candidate for SIRT, I hope I am.  Its not enough, we have kids and families who need us desperately and that is what keeps me going and trying to be positive.  I look at so many people with liver mets who live well once they find the magic chemo or therapy.  I just want to be like them and I will fight.
Posts.Title: Liver Mets...any effective treatment? njboo11 njboo11

Posts.Content: May 30, 2010 11:44PM tania_s wrote: Thanks everyone.  I have been to my general practitioner today and she will monitor my stomach aches and she also gave me anti nausea medication.  This Caelyx makes me sleep so much and I am on a tough regime with it - my oncologist is hitting me hard now, after so many drugs did not work.  Konakat, thanks for the site...I am going to look at it right now.  Nancy, every ache and pain worries me...it goes with this bloody disease we have to endure. But did you hear girls, there may be a breakthrough with a vaccine on experiment at the moment on mice - that reduces tumours or prevents bc.  Hope it is a worthwhile experiment....we need to hang in there.
